title: Trump orders airstrikes on Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen
content: US President Donald Trump ordered airstrikes on Houthi rebel targets in Yemen's capital, Sanaa, to halt attacks on shipping in a key maritime corridor. Trump warned the Houthis to stop their assaults or face overwhelming force. The operation, involving the USS Harry S. Truman carrier strike group, aims to restore maritime security and protect international trade.

title: Virat Kohli clears the air on retirement: 'Not making any announcements ...'
content: Virat Kohli hinted at potentially ending his Australia cricket tours and spoke about his uncertain post-retirement plans. Reflecting on India's recent cricket successes, he expressed pride in the ICC Champions Trophy win and optimism for women's cricket through the WPL. Kohli also showed enthusiasm for cricket's inclusion in the 2028 Olympics.

title: Elon Musk replies to Israel PM Netanyahu’s photo making a 'Tesla statement'
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu posted a photo with Elon Musk in front of the yet-to-be-released Tesla Cybertruck. Israel has invited Tesla to bid for electric vehicles for senior officials. Netanyahu also defended Musk against allegations of making a Nazi salute, asserting Musk's consistent support for Israel.

title: Watch: Tej Pratap rides scooty on Holi, calls out ‘Paltu chacha’
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, son of Lalu Yadav, celebrated Holi with RJD party workers in Patna. He mocked Bihar CM Nitish Kumar by shouting provocative remarks near his residence. Yadav also asked a police officer to dance under the threat of suspension in a festive, yet controversial, Holi celebration.

title: I don't bring religion & caste into my public discourse: Gadkari
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari emphasized his belief in service to society over religion or caste in public matters, even at the risk of losing elections or ministerial positions. Speaking at a minority institute’s convocation, he highlighted the transformative power of education, citing his support for the Anjuman-e-Islam institute and the success of its students.

title: Mumbai Indians beat Delhi Capitals to clinch second WPL title
content: Mumbai Indians won their second Women's Premier League title with an 8-run victory over Delhi Capitals. Nat Sciver-Brunt led the bowling attack with 3/30, restricting Delhi to 141 for 9 in response to Mumbai's 149 for 7, highlighted by Harmanpreet Kaur's 66 off 44 balls. Nat Sciver-Brunt was the pick of the bowlers for Mumbai, taking 3 for 30. Amelia Kerr chipped in with two wickets.

title: Infosys cofounder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion in India to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, addressed the hype around AI in India, stating that many systems are just traditional programming. He emphasized that genuine AI involves machine learning and deep learning, which can greatly enhance human-like capabilities.

title: Form government without Fadnavis: Patole woos Shinde and Ajit
content: Nana Patole, former Maharashtra Congress chief, extended a political invite to deputy CMs Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar, suggesting they form a government without CM Devendra Fadnavis if they feel constrained under his leadership. This adds to speculation about discord within Maharashtra's ruling coalition. Despite controversy, Patole remarked the invitation was in light spirits due to Holi.

title: 'I wasn't given food, signed 40 blank pages': Ranya Rao claims torture in custody
content: Ranya Rao, accused in a case, claims in a letter to the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence that she was falsely implicated, physically assaulted, and forced to sign documents under duress. She insists no evidence was recovered from her and requests that her statements given under pressure not be relied upon.

title: Musk on video of a man painting Swastika on Tesla: Crazy people. Naturally, he ...
content: In Brooklyn, a man defaced a Tesla Cybertruck with a swastika in front of a New York Post reporter. The suspect, Michael Lewis, returned to the scene to retrieve his car and was arrested. The owner, Avi Ben Hamo, expressed his shock and anger over the incident, highlighting increasing attacks on Tesla vehicles.

title: Only days spent in India to decide NRI tax status: ITAT
content: Mumbai ITAT ruled in favor of M Gulati, confirming his non-resident status as he spent 210 days abroad. The tribunal clarified that both employment and job search periods abroad qualify for non-residency. This ruling means non-residents are not taxed on overseas income, benefiting expatriates seeking employment abroad.

title: 3 delivery men killed in blaze at Rajkot building sans fire NOC for 10 years
content: Three delivery men died in a Rajkot building fire caused by a suspected electrical short circuit. The 12-storey Atlantis building had failed to renew its fire safety NOC for a decade. Despite notices from the municipal corporation, no action was taken, raising concerns over fire safety enforcement.

title: RBI says IndusInd Bank stable; to fix all discrepencies in seven days
content: The Reserve Bank of India has confirmed that IndusInd Bank is financially stable and adequately capitalised. Depositors are advised not to react to speculation concerning the bank's foreign exchange derivative portfolio discrepancies, which are to be resolved by March 31, 2025. The bank's financial ratios remain solid.

title: Bollywood songs banned in Pakistan colleges
content: Educational authorities in Pakistan's Punjab province officially banned the playing of Indian songs, especially Bollywood hits, in public and private colleges. This move aims to curb 'unethical and vulgar' activities noted by the higher education department during events like sports galas and other functions.

title: Cops suspect ISI involvement in blast at temple in Amritsar
content: A blast damaged the Thakurdwara temple in Amritsar's Khandwala after attackers on a bike hurled an explosive device. Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann blamed the assault on disruptive forces, while opposition leaders criticized the government's failure to maintain security and called for thorough investigations.

title: Amit Shah opens police academy in Assam, says it'll be best in 5 years
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised Assam's development, highlighting the opening of the Lachit Barphukan Police Academy and the relocation of Assam Rifles' headquarters in Mizoram. With a Rs 1,000 crore investment, the academy is set to become the best in India. Shah also emphasized Assam's advancements, including significant semiconductor industry investments and multiple peace agreements.

title: Suvendu's 'Muslim MLAs to be thrown out' claim: Why Left-Cong may be real loser
content: Suvendu Adhikari's anti-Muslim rhetoric has stirred West Bengal politics, drawing criticism from Mamata Banerjee and opposition leaders. This strategy aims to consolidate Hindu votes and counter internal BJP defections ahead of the 2026 state elections, shifting focus from BJP’s declining influence.

title: Rescue mission goes awry in MP: Hostage & ASI lynched by mob
content: A police rescue operation in Mauganj, MP turned fatal when a mob lynched both the hostage and an ASI. The incident occurred in Gadra, sparking violence linked to an earlier accident. Despite police efforts to mediate, the hostage was found dead, triggering the attack. Several suspects have been detained following the incident.

title: Joshua Riibe, detained in Indian-origin Sudiksha Konanki's disappearance, under 'irregular conditions,' says his family
content: Joshua Riibe, a person of interest in the disappearance of Sudiksha Konanki, a University of Pittsburgh student, is being held in the Dominican Republic under "irregular conditions." Konanki was last seen with Riibe and others at a Punta Cana beach. Riibe provided conflicting statements claiming he lost sight of Konanki in the water.

title: Who is Lex Fridman? Podcaster set to drop interview with PM Modi on Sunday
content: Lex Fridman announced the release of his podcast with PM Narendra Modi, discussing diverse topics including Modi's childhood, years in the Himalayas, and public life journey. Fridman praised the conversation as one of the most powerful in his life. The podcast is set to be published on March 16 at 8am EST / 5:30pm IST.

title: Aaron Judge urges Yankees to act fast on $56M star Sandy Alcantara
content: The New York Yankees face a pitching crisis with Gerrit Cole out for the season. Captain Aaron Judge advocates acquiring Miami Marlins' Sandy Alcántara but obtaining him requires trading valuable young prospects. The team must decide quickly on this challenging choice.

title: 'Thumka lagao' or get suspended: Tej Pratap's order to cop on Holi sparks row
content: RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav's Holi celebration with party workers sparked controversy after a video showed him ordering a policeman to dance, threatening suspension. Political opponents criticized the act, calling it a display of power abuse and reminiscent of past 'jungle raj' in Bihar.

title: Shocking: Woman's paramour throws toddler alive into canal in Haryana's Jind
content: A woman and her brother-in-law in Jind district conspired to murder her infant son, Yash, during Holi. They kidnapped Yash and drowned him in a canal. The police arrested the woman's paramour, Sonu, who confessed to the crime. The child’s body was recovered, and the investigation is underway.

title: PM Modi responds to Lex Fridman’s post on their 'epic' podcast
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed enthusiasm for his podcast conversation with Lex Fridman, discussing key moments from his life, including his childhood and public life journey. The podcast episode, deemed by Fridman as one of his most powerful conversations, will be released soon.

title: Lalu-style ‘kurta faad’ Holi returns as Bihar elections near
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, son of Lalu Yadav, ordered a police constable to dance during Holi celebrations to avoid suspension, stirring a controversy. The BJP criticized this act as reminiscent of 'Jungle Raj'. The incident comes as Bihar prepares for its upcoming assembly elections.

title: Prince William likely to have a new title as another royal baby is on the way
content: The Duke and Duchess of Westminster are expecting their first child, with Hugh Grosvenor possibly naming Prince William as the godfather due to their close friendship. The announcement comes shortly after their high-profile wedding in June 2024, attended by prominent royal family members.

title: 'A victory to cherish ...': VVS Laxman remembers iconic 2001 Kolkata Test win
content: Former India batter VVS Laxman reminisced on social media about the unforgettable 2001 Kolkata Test victory against Australia, calling it "a victory to cherish for a lifetime." Down 0-1 in the series, India staged a miraculous comeback with Laxman's 281 and a record 376-run partnership with Rahul Dravid. Harbhajan Singh's bowling sealed India's historic win.

title: 8-year-old raped in Bangladesh, dies after 3 cardiac arrests
content: An eight-year-old girl in Bangladesh succumbed to injuries after being raped, leading to widespread protests demanding justice and legal reforms. Authorities arrested several suspects, and the trial is anticipated to begin within seven days, seeking expedited justice under strict child protection laws.

title: Trump travel restriction on 41 countries in the works - full list
content: The Trump administration is preparing a three-tier travel restriction that will affect entry to the US from 41 countries, including an outright ban for 11 nations like Afghanistan and Bhutan. This move, a significant expansion of the previous travel ban, has caused alarm among potential immigrants, with final decisions due soon.

title: 'I'm 95 %...': Rashee Rice reveals that he convinced Travis Kelce not to retire
content: Travis Kelce confirms his return for the 2025 NFL season, influenced significantly by teammate Rashee Rice. Rice's passionate plea convinces Kelce to not retire after the Chiefs' Super Bowl LIX loss. Despite potential outside of football, Kelce aims for another championship with the Chiefs.

title: 'Beaten, ate jailed food': Amit Shah on detention under Cong govt in Assam
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah recollected his student days when he protested against Indira Gandhi in Assam, highlighting his detention and mistreatment under the Congress government. Shah also emphasized the peace restoration efforts and projected the Lachit Barphukan Police Academy to become a premier institution within five years.

title: Falcons keep Cousins, triggering bonus guarantee
content: The Falcons kept quarterback Kirk Cousins on their roster past 4 p.m. ET Saturday, triggering a guarantee on a $10 million roster bonus that is due in 2026.

title: NCAA: Duke says Flagg to be available for tourney
content: Duke star Cooper Flagg, who suffered an ankle injury during the ACC tournament, will "be available" for the NCAA tournament, according to Dan Gavitt, NCAA senior vice president of men's basketball.

title: Smith-Schuster returning to Chiefs, sources say
content: Free agent wide receiver JuJu Smith-Schuster is returning to the Kansas City Chiefs on a one-year deal.

title: Unrivaled DPOY Reese (hand) to miss semifinal
content: Newly minuted Unrivaled Defensive Player of the Year Angel Reese will miss the Rose's semifinal game vs. the Laces due to a hand injury.

title: Source: 49ers, Juszczyk reunite after brief split
content: After a brief parting, fullback Kyle Juszczyk is returning to the 49ers on a two-year, $8 million deal, a source told ESPN.

title: Real Madrid won't play without 72 hours' rest
content: Real Madrid's official TV channel have confirmed the team will refuse to play in future if their players aren't given a minimum 72 hours' rest between matches.

title: Men's Bracketology: Auburn stays No. 1 overall despite loss
content: Auburn and Michigan State are no longer the SEC and Big Ten automatic qualifiers. Their seeding, however, does not change.

title: Women's Bracketology: Ivy remains three-bid league as Princeton edges Virginia Tech for final spot on bubble
content: Princeton lost in the Ivy semifinals Friday, but played well enough to become the "Last Team In" the field. Virginia Tech remains "First Team Out."

title: 75 years of innovation: How F1 has evolved since 1950 and where it's headed
content: To celebrate F1's 75th anniversary, ESPN charts the sport's evolution since 1950 through its most iconic cars, and details where it's headed in 2026.

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Making sense of QB moves in NFL free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: NHL playoff watch: Dissecting the Eastern wild-card race
content: The Sens are in good shape, but five teams within two points are vying for the second spot. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: 'You don't hang banners for milestones': Tom Izzo adapts and takes aim at another title
content: Izzo is surpassing milestones and reached a big anniversary of his lone title. At 70, with a highly ranked team, he's hoping to add to his legacy.

title: Champions League qualification is the only positive Man City have left -- and they might miss it
content: Man City's awful season could end with one positive: qualification for next season's Champions League. But they are playing so poorly, they might not even get there.

title: One down, three to go: Chelsea on course for quadruple after League Cup win
content: Chelsea's bid to win four trophies was kickstarted with a 2-1 win over Man City in the League Cup final.

title: Pulisic helps rescue Milan again in comeback win
content: AC Milan staged a thrilling comeback to secure a 2-1 home win against Como in Serie A on Saturday, thanks to second-half goals by Christian Pulisic and Tijjani Reijnders.

title: USMNT's Haji Wright nets 1st hat trick in England
content: A 26-year-old from Los Angeles, Wright scored in the 21st minute, then converted a penalty kick in the 29th after he was fouled by Chris Mepham. Wright scored in the 73rd for his 10th goal in 19 league matches this season.

title: Man City's European hopes hit by draw vs. Brighton
content: Manchester City could only muster a 2-2 draw with Brighton on Saturday, dropping points in a blow to their hopes of playing in Europe next season.

title: Wrexham beat promotion rivals Wycombe; go 2nd
content: Wrexham took a huge step towards securing automatic promotion to the Championship with an important 1-0 against Wycombe Wanderers at Adams Park on Saturday.

title: USSF prez Parlow Cone elected to FIFA Council
content: U.S. Soccer Federation president Cindy Parlow Cone was elected to the FIFA Council on Saturday, as the North America representative from Concacaf.

title: Late Hollerbach goal stuns Bayern in Bundesliga
content: A moment of uncertainty from goalkeeper Jonas Urbig allowed Benedict Hollerbach to score a late goal as Union Berlin secured a 1-1 home draw with Bayern Munich.

title: Mascherano defends handling of Messi fitness
content: Inter Miami head coach Javier Mascherano revealed the team controlled Lionel Messi's fatigue well to avoid any injury.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Spurs defender Cristian Romero
content: A summer move for World Cup-winning defender Cristian Romero is being considered by Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: LeBron James watches on as Bryce, Sierra Canyon win state title Friday night
content: The Arizona Wildcats commit finished with 3 points, 5 rebounds and 2 assists as Sierra Canyon (Chatsworth, California) defeated Lincoln (Stockton, California) 58-53 on Friday night.

title: Actor Ranya Rao's Stepfather, DGP K Ramachandra Rao, Sent On Compulsory Leave
content: Actor Ranya Rao's stepfather, a senior cop in Karnataka, has been sent on "compulsory leave" days after the actor was arrested in a gold smuggling case.

title: "4% Quota Not Only For Muslims": DK Shivakumar On Big Karnataka Decision
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has backed Chief Minister Siddaramaiah over the 4 per cent quota issue, which the Congress's rivals called a move to appease Muslims.

title: Assam Congress Leader Arrested Over Social Media Post. Himanta Sarma Reacts
content: The arrest of Congress' Assam unit spokesperson, Reetam Singh, over a social media post has teed off a fresh war of words between the grand old party and the ruling BJP.

title: Punjab Man Who Caused Scientist's Death During Parking Fight Arrested
content: A man who allegedly pushed a 39-year-old scientist during a parking altercation in Punjab's Mohali, leading to the latter's death, was arrested on Saturday, police said.

title: Amid Tensions With Trump, Canada Reviewing Purchase Of F-35 Jets: Report
content: Canada is reviewing a major purchase of US-made F-35 combat planes amid serious tensions with the Trump administration, a spokesperson for the Canadian defence ministry told AFP on Saturday.

title: "Thumka Lagao Or Get Suspended": Tej Pratap Yadav's Order To Cop Sparks Row
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tej Pratap Yadav celebrated Holi with party workers at his official residence in Patna on Saturday. A video from the event, which has since gone viral on social media, has sparked controversy.

title: Pakistan, Bhutan Among 41 Countries On Trump's Potential Travel Ban List
content: The memo lists a total of 41 countries divided into three separate groups. The first group of 10 countries, including Afghanistan, Iran, Syria, Cuba and North Korea among others, would be set for a full visa suspension.

title: Virat Kohli's Cheeky Comment On T20I Retirement U-Turn: "If India..."
content: Virat Kohli announced his retirement from the format after the T20 World Cup final, which India won after beating South Africa in Barbados.

title: Centre Cracks Down On Amazon, Flipkart For Selling "Unsafe, Non-Certified" Items
content: To curb the distribution of non-compliant products through e-commerce platforms, the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) has carried out search and seizure operations at multiple warehouse locations of leading e-commerce platforms, including Amazon.

title: "Like Children Waiting To Know About Their Father": Nuns On Calls About Pope
content: How's Pope Francis doing? Can you give him my get-well wishes? Can I speak with him directly? The nuns who operate the Vatican's switchboard are fielding a growing number of calls with questions like that as the pope remains hospitalised in Rome.

title: "Fascinating Conversation": PM Shares Glimpses From Podcast With Lex Fridman
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared a sneak peek on Saturday into the areas of discussion he held with world-renowned scientist and podcaster Lex Fridman.

title: WPL 2025: Harmanpreet Stars As MI Beat DC In Final To Clinch Record 2nd Title
content: Delhi Capitals vs Mumbai Indians Final Highlights, Women's Premier League 2025: Mumbai Indians beat Delhi Capitals by 8 runs in the final of WPL 2025 on Saturday.

title: House Help Murdered At Football Legend PK Banerjee's House In Kolkata
content: A domestic help was allegedly murdered at the house of late Indian football legend PK Banerjee following a fight over stealing money in Kolkata's Salt Lake on Friday.

title: Karnataka BJP Leader, Cop In A Midnight Slap Fight. Video Is Viral
content: It appeared like a power slap contest. The match played out between a cop and a BJP leader in Karnataka.

title: Skull In Travel Bag, Jewellery Pouch: How Cops Caught Man Who Killed Wife
content: Police in Maharashtra's Palghar district have arrested a 49-year-old man for allegedly killing his wife two months ago and disposing of the body, an official said on Saturday.

title: BJP questions move by Telangana Govt. to include foreign economist in expert group to analyse caste survey data
content: The Congress govt. has roped in French economist Thomas Piketty as part of an 11-member committee for analysing the caste survey data; BJP asks if the ruling party does not trust Indian experts

title: Uninterrupted storytelling: a lone woman’s toil to take books to the masses through audios
content: Story-teller Ramya Vasudevan keeps piling up audio stories through a disciplined schedule of recordings

title: Tuhin Kanta Pandey | Market watchdog
content: The new SEBI chief says his focus will be on optimum regulation, not on maximum regulation, as he seeks to ensure fair practices at India’s security’s markets

title: ‘Two additional electronics manufacturing clusters to come up at ₹1,112 cr. in T.N.’
content: Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that the Railway budget for Tamil Nadu has increased many times since the UPA II regime and stands at more than 6000 crore

title: Multiple police personnel injured; man killed in Madhya Pradesh as clashes between groups turn violent
content: A government official, present at the spot, said that the dispute broke out over a road accident more than a month ago in which a man had passed away

title: New Delhi stampede: Two out of five transferred Railway officials get posting in NR Headquarter
content: Railway sources said that a high-level inquiry is underway to fix the accountability of those whose negligence led to the tragedy

title: Dharwad gets soaked in myriad colours
content: The soaring temperature didnot deter the holi celebrations on Saturday as the cultural city Dharwad got soaked in myriad colours with people of all age groups from toddlers to senior citizens came out in large numbers to celebrate the festival of colours.

title: Woman opts for 7-day 'digital custody' over 3-month police custody, loses Rs 34 lakh
content: Mateen Hafeez, special correspondent at The Times of India in Mumbai, reports on terrorism, underworld, cybercrime and organized crime syndicates. He also writes about the jails in Maharashtra and focuses on human interest stories. He has covered the Ghatkopar bomb blast, Vile Parle bomb blast, Mulund train blast, train serial blasts in 2006, 26/11 terror attacks and Pune's German Bakery bomb blast. He has a special interest in Urdu fiction written by Ibn-e-Safi. title: Team-by-team preview: Can Orlando repeat as champions?
content: the 2025 national women's soccer league season kicks off on friday . the top squads from 2024 have all bolstered their sides with strong additions in the offseason . many teams look like they are improved, but they will hope to restore the NWSL's much-lauded parity in 2025 .

title: Assam Congress spokesperson held over post on BJP MLAs
content: Prabin Kalita is a journalist at the Times of India and is currently the Chief of Bureau (northeast). he has been a field journalist reporting in mainstream Indian national media since 2001 . has been covering insurgency issues from India’s northeastern region and major developments in neighbouring countries .

title: Work pressure, verbal abuse discouraging doctors from taking up promotions, says govt. doctors’ body
content: Health Minister expresses concern over many associate professors and civil surgeons rejecting the offer to be promoted as professors and DCHSs

title: Facebook hired ‘ex-police captain’ in India for potential imprisonment, new book claims
content: At a time when Facebook was having trouble with law enforcement and government authorities outside the U.S., the company hired an ‘ex-police captain’ in India to go to jail on the company’s behalf in case of a clash between the company and the government, a new book alleges

title: Justice Joymalya Bagchi to be sworn in as SC judge on March 17
content: Once Justice Bagchi takes oath, the Supreme Court will have 33 judges against its sanctioned strength of 34

title: Tensions rise in Maharashtra over demand to demolish Aurangzeb’s tomb
content: The district administration has prohibited Milind Ekbote and his supporters from entering Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar district from March 16 to April 5

title: Two mega defence deals with France await clearance by Cabinet Committee on Security
content: The Navy is keen that the agreements for 26 Rafale-M fighter jets and three more Scorpene-class conventional submarines, worth a total of $11 billion, be inked this financial year

title: Girls dominate WAVES-2025 Young Filmmakers Challenge
content: Chaitanya Chinchlikar of Whistling Woods International said over 1,000 entries were received from close to 80 cities and towns across the country

title: Entire border with Myanmar to be fenced in ten years, say government officials
content: The proposal has faced stiff opposition from Naga and Kuki-Zo bodies, who have objected to the fencing saying it will disrupt ethnic and familial ties for people living on both sides of the border

title: The broadcasting services regulation bill: A threat to digital freedom and innovation
content: The bill’s too expansive measures, which could potentially subject even independent content creators to governmental scrutiny, are among its most controversial features

title: Eknath Shinde wanted to join Congress, says Sanjay Raut
content: Without specifying the timeline, the Shiv Sena (UBT) leader said Shinde had connected with Ahmed Patel, the late Congress leader and political secretary to former Congress president Sonia Gandhi

title: Congress slams Assam CM for the arrest of State spokesperson
content: Congress communication chief Jairam Ramesh, in a post on social media platform X, saying the action was “worse than atrocious”

title: Bengalureans forage for new experiences in their weekend getaways
content: “In the post-pandemic period, people’s interest in things like how their food is grown, the effort involved in farming and activities like sowing and harvesting has increased,” say industry insiders.

title: Supriya Sule slams Bill against urban Naxalism in Maharashtra
content: NCP(SP) MP Supriya Sule said that the Special Public Security Bill, tabled in the Assembly on July 11, 2024, undermines the very concept of “We, the People of India”

title: Beed Police drop surnames from official name plates to avoid ‘social tension’
content: Due to the deeply political nature of the district, people feel the powerful get the support of the system

title: State govt. releases updated investigation manual for tackling cybercrimes
content: The updated manual integrates the latest trends, tools, and methodologies to combat evolving cyber threats

title: Huge crowds gather to witness ‘Srinivasa Kalyanam’ in Andhra Pradesh’s capital Amaravati
content: TTD performs it in Sri Venkateswara Swamy temple at Venkatapalem; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu, along with his wife Bhuvaneswari, offers ‘pattu vastrams’ to the deities; 50,000 laddus, 40,000 packets each of ‘pulihora’, ‘ravva kesari’, curd rice and sweets distributed to devotees; vocal concerts by Priya Sisters, Nithyasri Mahadevan and other acclaimed classical singers enthral audience

title: What makes a tribe? Top anthropologists say the answer lies on a spectrum, not in a binary classification
content: This is a paradigm shift in approach from the Centre’s five-point criteria for inclusion in the ST list; a new tool could assess the “degree of tribalness” using a matrix of up to 150 indicators, anthropologists say

title: NHAI tells consultant to revise DPR for elevated highway on Aroor-Edappally NH stretch
content: Aroor-Thuravur elevated NH to be commissioned by February 2026; 55% of the work is completed so far, with 75% expected to be finished by August.

title: TDP leader murdered in Kurnool city
content: Kosapogu Sanjanna, a former Corporator, was waylaid and attacked near his home; his family members who went to his rescue also suffer injuries

title: Eight Madras varsity-affiliated colleges told to postpone graduation day ceremony
content: University held its 166th convocation in September but colleges are yet to distribute degree certificates

title: Surgical specimens lost and found at Thiruvananthapuram Government Medical College Hospital
content: The specimens, preserved in glass jars, were mistakenly taken by a scrap collector who found them left unattended on the steps outside the Pathology department

title: Tariff instability, delayed payment hinder KPTCL’s plans to venture into InvITs
content: InvITs are investment vehicles that allow investors to buy and operate infrastructure projects. The proposal was announced in this year’s budget and it awaits state government approval.

title: Pattikkad-Vilangannur stretch of hill highway opened
content: Public Works P.A. Mohamed Riyas says  the hill highway, funded by KIIFB, is a priority in terms of infrastructure development, with the aim to energise future projects.  The 793-km highway is being developed in phases, with 250 km expected to be completed by 2025

title: IMD predicts hot and humid weather in parts of Andhra Pradesh
content: Maximum temperatures are likely to be above normal by 2 to 4 degree Celsius across North and South Coastal Andhra Pradesh up to March 19

title: Abhishek Banerjee calls for stricter vigil to catch ghosts in Bengal voters’ list
content: The Trinamool leader announced that electoral roll supervisors will be appointed by the party and committees will be set up at the districts, blocks, panchayat, municipalities and booth level

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: free agency kicked off with the legal negotiation window on Monday . players can now officially sign with new teams as of Wednesday . the new league year was the start of the new season . a number of players have already signed with the seahawks .

title: Power Rankings: Capitals back at No. 1, plus each team's playoff scoring leaders
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday, which generates our master list . the top career playoff scorers for each of the league's teams are ranked by the NHL's official records site .

title: Did the Titans' free agency moves reveal what they'll do with the No. 1 pick?
content: the free agent quarterbacks flew off the list of options . they signed former 49ers backup Brandon Allen to a one-year, $1.4 million deal . it's hard to imagine a make-or-break season with Allen and Levis .

title: Neptune out as Villanova coach after 3 seasons
content: coach Kyle Neptune will serve as interim head coach while the school searches for his successor . "we are grateful to Kyle for his long service to Villanova and his mentorship," athletic director says . the wildcats briefly played their way onto the bubble toward the end of the regular season .

title: UNLV fires head coach Kruger after four seasons
content: the runnin' Rebels' season ended with a quarterfinal loss to Utah State . they finished 18-15 overall, 11-9 in conference play . UNLV athletic director praises the program's failure to meet expectations . the team has already begun its search for a new head coach .

title: TDP gave many opportunities to SCs, says Beeda Ravichandra
content: The TDP national general secretary receives a grand welcome in Nellore after being appointed as MLC for the second time under the MLA quota

title: 21.85% landless families in rural areas given land in Odisha
content: Lack of homestead land is a major hurdle in providing housing under the Pradhan Mantri Aawas Yojana-Gramin scheme, which stipulates the provision of homestead land by the State government

title: Jadavpur University loses Institute of Eminence tag: Teachers question refund of ₹1 crore application fee
content: This came after the prestigious university lost its IoE status due to decline in budgetary allocations

title: Farmer murdered, son critical after ‘tussle between rival parties’ in Punganur
content: The accused, identified as Kagiti Venkataramana, a YSRCP activist, allegedly stabbed his relatives, Kagiti Ramakrishna (55), a TDP activist, and his son Suresh (35), with a knife

title: Govt. cancels four title deeds, resumes 13.79 acre of encroached land at Chokramudi
content: Revenue Minister warns of strict action against those encroaching on government land and the officials assisting them

title: Government’s goal is a drug-free community: Minister
content: Increasing drug use among youth is leaving a devastating impact on society, says R. Bindu, urging NSS and NCC students to join the fight against drugs

title: Centre must bring in a policy to end agri distress, says Sharad Pawar, amid rising farmer suicides in Maharashtra
content: There were 2,635 farmer suicides in Marathwada and Vidarbha in 2024, says recent State government data; Mr. Pawar also seeks PM’s help to install equestrian statues of Maratha leaders in Delhi

title: Teacher from Kozhikode takes part in Great Challenge Fund Program in London
content: Shajil U. K. is the only Keralite among 10 educators selected from across India for the event aimed at cultivating scientific temperament among students

title: Undersized sardines a major concern for fishers
content: Fishers say the size of sardine is decreasing due to climate change, leading to plummeting market prices and forcing them to sell their catch to fish meal plants.

title: We are flagging threats to economy, when will PM Modi listen, Congress asks
content: Congress general secretary incharge communications Jairam Ramesh cited the remarks of Chief Investment Officer of Marcellus Investments, Saurabh Mukherjea, to press his argument

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: 'Hold that rock up, baby': DK Metcalf reveals engagement to Normani
content: the two-time pro bowler revealed he's engaged to R&B star Normani . the couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by singer Ciara . he joined fifth Harmony, a girl group formed from solo contestants .
